summary: a primary school in china notified Shunyi CDC of an outbreak of acute respiratory disease characterized by fever and cough among students. we defined probable cases as students, teachers and other staffs in the school developed fever (T 37.5 °C) with cough or sore throat; or a diagnosis of pneumonia during May 1–June 31, 2018. M. pneumoniae could cause serious complications which require long-term hospitalization. it is necessary to establish and improve the pathogen and drug resistance surveillance system to prevent and control such mutated strains.
